channel.title: This motor shortage is a ballache
channel.description: Trying to buy hard drives in numbers sucks at the moment. Anyone aware of any diamonds in the rough that still have stock at reasonable prices? Mostly looking for fast SAS drives but in need of some standard SATA too. :(

item.title: This motor shortage is a ballache
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Thankfully I’m not in the market for one, since I decided to make my mediacenter diskless with an NFS root filesystem (it’s awesome!). Maybe now is the time to try to unload my supply of 60gb to 120gb IDE hard drives that I have laying around all over the house? Anyone want to bid?

No buying/selling on these forums. Banned.

Read full topic
item.source: This motor shortage is a ballache

item.title: This motor shortage is a ballache
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

You still wanting them? I can get them from my dad. Let me know what sizes and I can give you a price, all brand new.

item.title: This motor shortage is a ballache
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

SSDs are a lot less affected afaik, since the main problem is with companies like Nidec, which aren’t involved in SSD.

Unfortunately they’re also no use to me But i can see it being more tempting for people building desktops atm

Read full topic

item.title: This motor shortage is a ballache
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:16, topic:421975”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=524656.msg3818913#msg3818913 date=1321584232]
Thankfully I’m not in the market for one, since I decided to make my mediacenter diskless with an NFS root filesystem (it’s awesome!). Maybe now is the time to try to unload my supply of 60gb to 120gb IDE hard drives that I have laying around all over the house? Anyone want to bid?
[/quote]I made my mediacenter ssd-driven, and ssd’s are obviously no affected by this disaster either :)[/quote]

I’m sure that SSD’s are also affected just because supply on hard drives as a whole is down.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I have been emoing about this for the past few weeks, watching prices slowly raise and rumour is that it will be March before production continues as normal.

Happened like a week before I needed a disk

item.title: This motor shortage is a ballache
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Sometimes more than twice as much as before. OEMs have been ordering up the remaining stock pushing the prices up so they’re not short for xmas, which has pushed the prices up massively for retailers.

Read full topic
